text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with crispy pork cutlets with a

right this is kind of a German schnitzel
meets southern country cooking and by
the way not only am I going to show you
a super tasty recipe but I'm also going
to revolutionize the way you bread
cutlets and I'm serious there's no
hyperbole involved in that statement
alright so step one we're going to prep
our pork I'm using pork tenderloin you
want it fully trimmed so there's no
silver skin one whole pork tenderloin is
going to give you four cutlets so I'm
going to cut that in half I'm going to
cut each half in half and then we're
simply going to turn those cut side up
on a piece of plastic put another piece
of plastic over and just give it a
little pounding I'm using my little
round meat pounder there but anything
heavy will work and I want to flatten
those down to just under a half inch
maybe 3/8 inch all right just like that
so once those are flattened out I'm
going to place those on a plate and we
are gonna season those generously with
salt and pepper
I don't trust seasoned flour I never
have and I never will all right so I
want my seasoning attached to the meat
all right once those are seasoned I'm
going to sprinkle those with flour and
this is the first step of
revolutionising you're dredging system
there's no need for a big dish of flour
this way
you only use a tablespoon or so they get
coated and there's nothing to throw away
so I think it works much better alright
so once both sides are dusted and coated
with the flour it's on to the next stage
of the revolution and we're going to go
ahead and dump the beaten egg right on
this plate and I know what you're
thinking are we supposed to use like two
eggs and do them in a big bowl so we
throw away a whole bunch of extra no do
it this way so dump your egg right on
the plate and just toss those until
they're coated that's right the days of
the three pan breading station are over
once those are coated with the egg then
and only then are they to be transferred
into your bowl of breadcrumbs which I'm
using panko the ultimate bread crumb all
right I'm gonna get it started with my
tongs so my hands don't get all messed
up and you may have heard of the wet
hand dry hand method I prefer the wet
tongue dry hands method so I started
with my tongs then I go to the
fingertips and once those are thoroughly
breaded I'm going to put those on a
plate and what I like to do is place
those uncovered in the fridge for 15
minutes to really let that coating it
here and draw
out a little bit I really think it makes
for a nicer crust so we're gonna put
that in the fridge for 15 minutes and
it's on to our creamy how a panel and
green onion gravy although the first
thing we're gonna prep here is the
secret ingredient some diced dill
pickles
all right I'm using the small gherkins
but those are dill not sweet I'm just

to add a really interesting textural and

awesome
all right I'm also going to mince up

sort of julienne that and then mince it
up and then last but not least a whole

all right big pinch of salt of course
we're gonna give it some Cayenne so
we're gonna cook that about three or

the onions start to soften a little bit
we definitely want to keep some texture
in the vegetables all right so I don't
want this soft and mushy so they should
look something like that at that point
I'm going to add my flour I'm gonna cook

going to add our cold milk and if you
know what I'm about to say you've

cold milk hot Roux no lumps so we're
gonna splash in the cold milk a little
bit at a time
I'm not even using a whisk that's how

you can dump the rest in a few drips of

it tastes just as beautiful at that

make sure it gets hot how do you know
well if you touch the cutlet to the hot
oil and it doesn't start bubbling
instantly it's not hot and that's a big
deal because we want the outside to seal
and get crispy we don't want this to
absorb a whole bunch of oil anyway mine
went about four or five minutes per side
until they were cooked through and when
it feels kind of firm and springy it's
done
if it feels mushy it's still raw you'll
know use the force I've imparted to you

don't even realize it happen but it did
